comments: For n>=3, a(n) is equal to the number of functions f:{1,2,...,n}->{1,2,3,4} such that for fixed, different x_1, x_2, x_3 in {1,2,...,n} and fixed y_1, y_2, y_3 in {1,2,3,4} we have f(x_i)<>y_i, (i=1,2,...,n). - _Milan Janjic_, May 13 2007
links: Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (4).
author: _Barry E. Williams_, Jul 05 2000
extensions: a(21) corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 03 2014
